text.p: Here are the main headlines from Lithuania's M-1 plus radio station's noon news report on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Prime Minister Gediminas Vagnorius has left for official visits to Denmark and Belgium. The prime minister expects that the visits will advance Lithuania's bid for membership in the European Union.

- Political and military consultations between the Baltic countries and Denmark continue in the Lithuanian foreign affairs ministry. Sources say that Denmark is working on the formation of a group to coordinate security issues in the region involving the Baltic, Nordic and large European countries and the United States.
